---
title: "Route53"
description: "This guide walks you through the steps to enable Route53 Integration in Cloudsania."
---

Integrating  Route53 with Cloudsania allows for seamless **domain management, DNS automation, and infrastructure scalability**. With this integration, you can manage DNS records and streamline cloud-based network services directly from the Cloudsania platform

<Note>
  If you have already set up a **AWS Cloud Connector**, the integration is automatically enabled. If not, follow the [**AWS**](https://developer.cloudsania.com/cloudServiceProviders/aws)[ **Cloud Connector Setup Guide**](https://developer.cloudsania.com/cloudServiceProviders/aws) .
</Note>

## ðŸ”— ![GitHub Logo and symbol, meaning ...](data:image/png;base64,)![GitHub Logo and symbol, meaning ...](data:image/png;base64,) **How to Enable DigitalOcean Integration**

Before the Route53 Integration can be enabled, the following requirement must be met;

1. A **configured AWS Cloud Connector** ([Setup Guide](https://developer.cloudsania.com/cloudServiceProviders/digitalOcean))

## **Enabling** Route53 **Integration**

Since the Route53 **Integration** is automatically enabled upon setting up a AWS Cloud Connector, follow these steps to verify and manage the integration.

## ðŸ”—  **Step 1: Navigate to the Integrations Page**

1. **Log in** to your **Cloudsania** account.

2. Click on **Integrations** in the **left nav bar**.

3. Locate Route53 in the list of available integrations.

## ðŸ”— **Step 2: Verify** Route53 **Integration**

1. If the **AWS Cloud Connector** has already been set up, the **integration toggle** should be enabled automatically.

2. You can now manage Route53 DNS records within Cloudsania.ðŸš€
